item.title: If You Own Stalker 2's Ultimate Edition, Make Sure To Grab This Killer Assault Rifle
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/stalker-2-lullaby-assault-rifle-ultimate-edition-worth-1851713008

As with the Riemann SMG, the Lullaby in S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl is another high-end, unique weapon locked behind a specific side quest that’s only obtainable by paying for the Ultimate Edition. If you’re willing to fork over the extra cash, you’ll receive additional Journalist’s Stash quests.

Suggested Reading

Live Forever in the Universe of 'New World: Aeternum'

Suggested Reading

One quest in particular leads you to the Army Warehouse in the Chemical Plant region of the Zone. It’s a dangerous area, filled with bandits and Snorks. My first time setting foot outside the Army Warehouse was pitch-black, and a small horde of Snorks ambushed me from all sides. It was one of the most terrifying gun battles of my playthrough. But in the end, I prevailed and walked away with the Lullaby.

Where To Get The Lullaby Unique Assault Rifle

When I initially learned about the location of Lullaby, I thought its proximity to the Lesser Zone would mean a cakewalk compared to the Riemann SMG up north. I was incorrect, though. You see, the Chemical Plant is filled with enemies, and due to the A-Life quirks, they continuously spawn. By the time I clambered through the upstairs window to open the Journalist’s Stash to acquire the Lullaby, two more bandit groups and another small horde of Snorks spawned and were fighting in the streets below.

But for now, let’s focus on acquiring the unique assault rifle. To get it, start by climbing up the truck outside the front entrance until you’re aligned with the second floor, then hop across to the awning hanging over the front door. From here, mantle over the windowsill and into the second-floor hallway.

You’ll end up in front of a locked gate leading to the first floor. Ignore this for now, but turn left down the hall and enter the last room on the left-hand side. It’s the one with the hole in the exterior wall. You’ll find the stash with Lullaby inside the back corner of the room.

Once you have the weapon, leave the area immediately. Enemies will continuously spawn around the corner and across the bridge, pinning you between warring factions as you attempt to evacuate. Oh, and Lullaby is heavy, so it may weigh you down and force you to walk out of the area instead of running.

Read More: Don’t Let Your Weapons Decay If You Want To Survive Stalker 2

Of course, once you have Lullaby and any other unique weapons you want to wield, don’t forget to maintain them. A bit of decay can leave you a bit dead in the Zone!

.

item.title: Got Stalker 2’s Deluxe Edition? Don't Miss This Amazing SMG
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/stalker-2-riemann-smg-deluxe-edition-dlc-worth-it-find-1851713004

Before we dive too deep into this guide on how to acquire the Riemann SMG in S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl, it’s important to note that this fast-firing, early-game submachine gun is only available to those who purchase the Deluxe Edition DLC. It’s part of the “Journalist’s Stash” questline, which features high-end loot scattered across the Zone.

Suggested Reading

The Week In Games: A Star Wars Classic Returns & More New Releases

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

Tracking down this unique, custom-built submachine gun, while hazardous to your health, is worthwhile. It’s a powerful, fast-firing weapon capable of dealing with mutants or human enemies in close quarters with relative ease. Here’s where to get one of your very own so that I’m not the only one having fun with this unique red-and-black SMG!

Where To Find The Riemann SMG

First and foremost, ensure you scoop up the Journalist’s recording from the stash box in the barracks in the back room of the trader at Zalissya. It’s all part of the “Seek and You Shall Find” side quest, which involves tracking down the Journalist’s Stashes across the map. One of the first locations you should focus on is in Rostock, northwest of Zalissya and just outside Garbage. It’s a trek but a worthwhile one.

In the screenshot above, you’ll note the green icon denoting the player’s location at a rectangular military complex northwest of Rostock. It’s a short walk from the Slag Heap, though you’ll encounter plenty of mutants, anomalies, and bandits on the journey, so be mindful of your surroundings and don’t walk through the swamp. It’s deadly.

Once you arrive at the barracks, be wary of the gravity anomalies outside and inside. You can toss a screw into any of the floating anomalies to disperse them momentarily, allowing you to pass. Once you’re through the anomalous obstacle course, head inside the Eastern entrance, then turn left inside the building to navigate through the broken barracks. You’ll find the blue crate containing the Riemann SMG in the far back corner between two bunk beds.

The Riemann SMG, is a competent submachine gun capable of propelling you through the mid- and late-game missions in Stalker 2. It features a high rate of fire, exceptional accuracy, and moderate range/ Its relatively low damage per shot is offset by the high DPS . Lastly, it goes for approximately 32,000 coupons if you choose to sell the rifle.

Of course, the Riemann SMG in Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl is only one of the many unique weapons across the Zone. The Lullaby is another high-end assault rifle you can track down even earlier!

.
